DataElement.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire How Helpful has Knowing the Prognosis Been for Maintaining Hope 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how helpful knowing about the prognosis has been for their loved one to maintain hope, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire How Helpful has Knowing Your Prognosis Been for Maintaining Hope
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care._ A question about helpful it's been to a person to know about the patient's prognosis in maintaining hope.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Concepts.definition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Property.preferredName: How Helpful has Knowing Your Prognosis Been for Maintaining Hope
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about helpful it's been to a person to know about the patient's prognosis in maintaining hope.

Concepts.longName: How Helpful has Knowing Your Prognosis Been for Maintaining Hope
Concepts.definition: A question about helpful it's been to a person to know about the patient's prognosis in maintaining hope.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/28/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with four text responses related to how helpful something has been to an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of non-agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of non-agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of very mild agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of very mild agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of extreme agreement regarding the helpfulness of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
